root: ^Then there is no piercing the veil? Surely the Dust Mystics have one among their number…
^No, mighty Scyllith. Many Shadows before you have, in rage or in grief, sought their council. They can certainly help you heal. But none can help you pass the veil.
^It’s not fair. There is no justice in this. Where is the balance? Are you content with these foul laws?
^I... I had only just earned my title. Had just passed my trials. And I am expected to let it go, because someone got bored.
^Miss Scyllith, would you care for a bit of tea while you talk?
^I am not here to sip tea, Shadow Shepherd. You will not presume to speak to me.
^Now, our Chef Tin makes the best Spider Tea. I can set it down and you can drink it when-
^I am the mighty Scyllith, princess of the great Kharitbr House. I will not be condescended to!
^She is a real challenge, isn’t she?
^Why did you send me back? You know good and well I don’t need you magicking me to and fro!
^I acted in haste. The way she appeared aboard badly startled me.

^She was furious, that’s true… Poor dear died witnessing a massacre, it sounds like. Maybe you were right to teleport me, anyway! It looks like I have made quite a mess of things. Talking them through was never my strong suit.
^Blackbird of my heart, do you know why we work together so well?
^Grumble grumble… What is it you say? That I heal their hearts and you soothe their souls?
^How is it your fault that we got a new passenger with a perfectly full heart and a deeply wounded soul?
^You are too good with words, Mr. Crow.
^You are too good with words, Mr. Crow.
^And you know just what everyone needs. I am very sorry I teleported you away. I shouldn’t have done that.
^You old bird. I can’t stay cross with you for long. Say… I have an idea. Are you in the mood for a little bit of tea?
